Also, we independently perform perplexity minimization for all four features of the standard SMTtranslation model: the phrase translation probabilities p (t|s) and p (s|t), and the lexical weights lex (t|s) and lex (s|t)

Reference Text: <S sid="50" ssid="14">Linear weights are difficult to incorporate into the standard MERT procedure because they are “hidden” within a top-level probability that represents the linear combination.1 Following previous work (Foster and Kuhn, 2007), we circumvent this problem by choosing weights to optimize corpus loglikelihood, which is roughly speaking the training criterion used by the LM and TM themselves.</S>
